p: At the time of delivery, the mean serum HBV DNA levels in the LdT-treated group were significantly lower than that in control group (Table 2). The mean serum HBV DNA levels of LdT-treated group dropped from 7.88 ± 0.42 to 3.78 ± 0.56 log 10 copies/mL at the time of delivery, whereas mean serum HBV DNA levels of control group remained high. At the 12th postpartum week, the average serum HBV DNA levels in the LdT group were 3.10 ± 0.34 log 10 copies/mL, much lower than that in control groups ( P < .001).
